attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 17 March 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (+36.0 loaves)

Ø  Utto- (-1.4 kg)

Ø  Polybags-  (+408 pieces)
attributes.recommendation: ·        Proper controls should be maintained

value: We will maintain.
There is a great improvement from the previous findings and we will continue improving.
A cumulative shortfall of 719.5 loaves and polybags variance of +637 pieces was reported in the previous audit findings.
Previous
Minimal variances noted is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
Bread weight check

Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        All sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 07%, 400g BT- 0%, 400g W- 05% and 800g W- 02%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.

value: We will continue making improvements.
More control measures will be initiated.
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.
·        Minimal cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are being observed.

attributes.title: Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
·        Analysis of bread damages from 21.02.25 – 16.03.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 1,075 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.20% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,098 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.21% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        No significant variance from the set limits was noted

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The effective controls should be maintained

value: Effective controls will be maintained.
To be maintained.
Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.
·        Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart analysis
attributes.description:
·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 21.02.25 – 16.03.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

·        No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.

value: We will maintain
To be maintained
No variances was reported in the previous audit findings
Production standards were observed.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch cash was well maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained.

value: To be maintained.
The positive trend will be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.
·        The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

attributes.title: Minishops spot-checks
attributes.description:
·        Spot checks was done on the branch minishops to find out if they were run as per the company policy.

·        On the spot-check days, no issue of non-compliance was noted in the visited minishops.
attributes.recommendation: Minishops SOPs to continue being observed.

value: To be maintained
The positive trend will be maintained.
SOPs were observed in the previous audit findings.
Minishop SOPs are being observed.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description: ·        Production efficiency was analyzed from 20.01.25 – 20.02.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set standard.
attributes.recommendation: The management should maintain the proper planning of production workers.

value: To be maintained
We will maintain the positive trend
The set efficiency was achieved in the previous audit findings
No significant variation from the set target efficiency was noted indicating that labour cost incurred was within the forecasted range.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
·        The total converted bread produced over the audited period is 40,379 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 416 workers.

·        A total of 518 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 96.6 crates per worker which is slightly below the target.

Packaging efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to improve on the planning of slicing and packaging workers to ensure that the set packaging efficiency is consistently achieved.

value: We will improve on the packaging efficiency.
To be improved.
Both packaging and production efficiencies were achieved in the previous audit findings.
No significant variation from the set target efficiency was noted indicating that labour cost incurred was within the forecasted range.

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage analysis
attributes.description: Analysis of delivery vehicle fuel consumption rates to determine if their usage were within the set standards.
attributes.recommendation: The set controls on fuel usage should be strictly adhered.

value: We will  maintain
We will continue to observe the effective controls
No previous audit findings
Fuel consumption rates are within the acceptable range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

attributes.title: Generator analysis
attributes.description:
Generator fuel consumption rate was analyzed to determine if its consumption rate is within the set standard. Its consumption is within the range.

Generator fuel consumption

value: We will maintained
To be maintained
No previous audit findings
Fuel consumption rate is within the acceptable range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.
